name: Nicole
desc: A prophetess and a member of the Hexenzirkel. She is also known as Nicole Reeyn and N. She is, presumably, one of the last seelies who remained conscious. She lost her voice and can only talk inside people's heads.

customize.text: Story Teaser: The Mages' Tea Party

<color=#ffd780>March 7, 2023</color>
Upon receiving a message from the ancient lamp out of the blue, even the Great Adventurer of the Realms, Author of the Teyvat Travel Guide, Supplier to the Renowned Lord Sangemah Bay, Elder of the Hexenzirkel, Codename "A," Mother of the Most Adorable Klee — Alice was taken aback.
Fortunately, it was not a disastrous incident that had prompted the message. Instead, it served to bring back memories of companions whom she shared her youth with.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>

customize.name: Hexenzirkel
customize.desc: A secret witch society, which discusses secrets at the tea parties and explores Irminsul. There are eight witches in the Hexenzirkel.

customize.text: Nicole is a member of the Hexenzirkel.

customize.name: Alice
customize.desc: The Great Adventurer of the Realms, Dodo-King, Defender of Old Mondstadt, Friend of Adults Who Yet Harbor Hope, Author of the Teyvat Travel Guide, Originator of the Kujirai Art - Temari Jutsu, Supplier to the Renowned Lord Sangemah Bay, Elder and founder of the Hexenzirkel, Codename "A," Mother of Klee.

customize.name: Rhinedottir
customize.desc: An alchemist, a member of the Hexenzirkel, one of the five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, and Albedo's mother. Rhinedottir created an army of shadowy monsters, who attacked Teyvat 500 years ago. She's also known as Gold and R.

customize.name: Barbeloth
customize.desc: A visionary, a member of the Hexenzirkel, and Mona's teacher. She is also known as Astromancer Barbeloth Trismegistus and "B."

customize.name: Andersdotter
customize.desc: Anya M. Andersdotter was a mortal writer from Mondstadt and a member of the Hexenzirkel.

customize.name: I. Ivanovna N.
customize.desc: A member of the Hexenzirkel and the first Mayor of Snezhnaya.

customize.name: The Little Witch and the Undying Fire
Alice
customize.desc: The Great Adventurer of the Realms, Dodo-King, Defender of Old Mondstadt, Friend of Adults Who Yet Harbor Hope, Author of the Teyvat Travel Guide, Originator of the Kujirai Art - Temari Jutsu, Supplier to the Renowned Lord Sangemah Bay, Elder and founder of the Hexenzirkel, Codename "A," Mother of Klee.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>About the Hexenzirkel</color>
The "guide who will never get lost" is N, otherwise known as Nicole. You may have not encountered her yet, but she is a truly extraordinary woman who has made this world's direction and order her subject of study.
Some of you may be fortunate enough to have already heard her voice. Like a prophetess, she will only speak to guide people toward the truth when a change has occurred in the world.
She has a tendency to... suddenly speak in someone's mind without any warning.
If one day, you would be unfortunate enough to run into a truly dangerous situation, she may use her voice to guide the way forward for you.

<color=#ffd780>About wolves</color>
Why not wolves? Many a tale has wolves in it, and even the compendium personally burned by Madame Mage had a wolf character!
It is said that the Boar Tribe were once all wild boars, but the boars did bad things, so the master wanted to punish them.
The master took out a rusted set of scales, and told the boars to stack their own things on both sides. If the scales tipped to one side, they could leave.
But the scales were so rusty that putting just a small amount of weight was not enough to move them.
Those boars who placed their heads on the scales became wolves, lizards, and snakes, leaving only their strength. Those who offered their muscles became rabbits, leaping three paces to a bound, instinctively guiding people to treasure.
But there was one boar who placed things evenly on both sides, until the rusted scale broke right down the middle...
And so she became a mute person — for she had placed her voice upon the scales as well.
She is also a friend of Madame Mage, and I hear she likes to speak in people's heads!

desc.text:
(Messy handwriting. This doesn't seem much like a fortune slip...)
In truth, I said all I wished to say to you in the end, but Alice still advised me to write a little, saying that what I cannot say aloud, I can always write, surely. That is the case, though I have spoken directly into peoples' minds for so long... that I never practiced my penmanship anyway.
No need to worry if I've pried into any of your innermost thoughts, I've never done anything like that. If that does not reassure you, let me share one of my secrets with you. Having been suffocated by my inability to speak, I wound up being an incredibly talkative person at first. Alice noted that those who used their real mouths to blather on with had far fewer problems than I, since I would set my head abuzz and give myself quite a headache whenever I spoke. She advised me to speak more steadily and present an air of mystery and nobility — which is how I wound up speaking the way you remember.
I'm off, in any case. There's not much to worry about here with you — so why don't you watch over me instead?

<color=#ffffffd9>(Archon Quest Interlude Chapter: Act III - Inversion of Genesis, As Though Morning Dew)</color>
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : You sound lost and confused.
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : ...Who's that?
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : I know why you are troubled. Any who knew of this would find their mind overwhelmed.
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : Huh? Is there someone here talking to us?
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : Unfortunately, the fate of Teyvat cannot easily be changed. Perhaps a god may have a slim chance, but for anyone else... who can say.
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : When a small animal runs into a tree trunk, though the tree may sway, it is not displaced. The same is true of fate.
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : Like a vase that falls to the ground. Whether it is broken by a cat or by a bird, the result is still a broken vase, is it not?
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : Wh—Who are you!? How do you know about all this?
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : History does not change easily, but human hearts can. Believe your own eyes. Only that which you see is true. What is unseen is but an illusion.

<color=#ffffffd9>(Archon Quest Chapter IV: Act V - Masquerade of the Guilty, Hunters, Prophets)</color>
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : Uh, did you just pour some tea? Paimon didn't notice you doing that at all!
<color=#37ffff>Traveler</color> : No, I didn't.
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : Th—Then what's that?
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : ...Paimon's never seen that cup before!
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : Don't be frightened. I'm just joining you two for tea. I merely refrained from saying anything till now.
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : Ah! Who's that voice!? But there's no one here!
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : Ah, have you forgotten me already?
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : Wait... You *are* familiar...
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : You're the voice we heard from the sky in Sumeru!
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : "The voice from the sky," hmm? I fear that description is wrong — though not completely wrong.
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : You're feeling lost now, just as you were feeling previously. I sensed that confusion, and thus came to you. Guiding people is an irresistible hobby of mine, after all.
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : Who are you? And what do you want with us?
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : Consider me a passerby, just accepting a commission from my friend's disciple on a whim.
<color=#37ffff>Traveler</color> : Allow me to ask you...
<color=#37ffff>Traveler</color> : Will Fontaine's prophecy come true?
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : The prophecy... Yes, what has been prophesized will be fulfilled. You may view such things as "the history of the future."
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : What... Th—Then, is there any way we can stop it?
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : People call such things "fate," and it is written in the stars — it cannot so easily be altered.
<color=#37ffff>Traveler</color> : There it is again... "fate."
<color=#37ffff>Traveler</color> : Can there really be no exceptions?
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : Ah, so you've caught on.
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : Just as prophecies are usually only the future as seen from the perspectives of the gods, could things be happening in hidden corners where the gods' gaze does not fall?
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : Are the things that you shall see different from the fate that the gods perceive?
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : Wh—What is she talking about? It all sounds really impressive and important and stuff... but it also sounds kinda scary.
(The tea in the teacup is just about gone as well...)
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : I believe that you understand, right? Some things are insignificant... but others, you must reach out to change.
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : Ultimately, fate shall serve as your only guide no matter what will happen in Teyvat's future. All you need to do is to play your part.
<color=#37ffff>Nicole</color> : This was good tea, by the way. Thank you for your hospitality. Well, that'll be all for today.
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : The voice... it's gone.
